Reviews.Title: “Kind staff. Somewhat small rooms. Very quiet location.”
Reviews.Author: serokisa
Reviews.Content: The hotel provides good service level, however, some rooms are quite small. Guess, because the hotel is in an old building. Location is good, however, not excellent - you still need to walk both to U-bahn (metro) and to the major shops of Kurfustendamm. Advantage - lots of correctly priced neraby restaurants ( sushi, Indian, Italian..).

Reviews.Title: “Our first visit to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: itsthewayitellem
Reviews.Content: Situated in a quiet, leafy district just off Kurfurstenstrasse, shopping and easy access to all tourist attractions. Hotel welcoming , and friendly owner and staff. Nothing is too much trouble. Rooms warm, and very comfortable beds. Breakfast - well you can have smoked salmon, cheese, ham etc etc.good coffee and lots !

Reviews.Title: “A clean friendly hotel with wonderful breakfasts and a good location”
Reviews.Author: davidf963
Reviews.Content: Our party of five stayed here for four nights in November. The hotel is located in a good area just ten minutes stroll to Kurfustendam. There are nearby restaurants which the hotel staff were able to recommend and each was ideal in its own way. Our rooms were small but the hotel more than made up for this with their friendly care and attention. Breakfast was included in our package and was just about the best continental breakfast that we have had. The rooms were spotless and the whole hotel is furnished in an attractive art decor style. We purchased the Berlin Welcome cards from the hotel and this allowed us to walk to Kurfustendam and pick up a local bus to the Zoo area terminus where we were able to to use the 100 and 200 local buses that seem to include virtually all of the tourist sights on route. If we return to Berlin we will definitely stay at Hotel Alexander.

Reviews.Title: “great great great”
Reviews.Author: drsuess2000
Reviews.Content: bought it last minute, great location, HUGE room very clean lovely staff they took all our fake tan towels away and never said anything!! I loved Berlin and this hotel was the icing on the cake!!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: SeasonedTraveller18
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 days at the Hotel Alexander, Berlin. Although the official rating is 3 stars - it is very much 3* superior. With its' sophisticated entrance and red,black and grey colour theme it is very chic - like a boutique hotel. It is housed on a few floors in a turn of the 20th century buildings with high ceilings and the original ceiling mouldings. Location-wise, you are a stone's throw from the main street the Kurfurstendamm. Breakfast is served in the Bar/Dining room and offers everything from eggs, cold meats, fruit, cheeses, pastries, fruit juices and a variety of hot drinks. We were lucky enough to have a room with a balcony. Bikes are available to hire from the hotel owner. With these we went on a self-guided tour making full use of the bike lanes that are prevalent in Berlin. Room rates vary from Euros 79 to 125 for a double room with breakfast depending on the season.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: BAEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: A good value hotel. Clean and comfortable, breakfasts very nice. Staff very friendly. Only point I would mention is distance from U-Bahn (7mins) and S-bahn (quicker to get to city centre) (10 mins). It doesn't sound far but after a long day sightseeing if I could have been closer to a station I would have liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: jrankw
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location within two blocks of Ku'Damm. Rooms are spacious and clean (no air conditioning so may be very hot in summer but so are all the rest of European smalll hotels). Service is great and the overall ambience is very nice. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: derob
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers excellent value for its price. The first time I stayed here I got it recommended by locals. When I had to stay in Berlin for a second time on a low budget business trip (which ruled out the standard hotels such as the intercontinental) I did not hesitate booking this hotel again. It is in a safe, quiet area just outside the tourist area, a 3 minutes walk from the nearest subway station on the kurfursten damm, and about 15 minutes walk to the zoo area. The rooms are large enough to move around (though maybe a bit over-designed), the beds are comfortable, the bathrooms are clean and the breakfast very good. There are cheap (non-tourist) restaurants nearby. I think this is all you need. BTW, if I remember well, they don´t have an elevator. You can get in late using a night key but don´t forget to ask the location of the electronic lock. In case of a late arrival (my second visit) they wait if you tell in advance.
